alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 8:05PM PDT until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 930 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water could flow over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 805 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, El Cajon, La Mesa, Poway, Ramona, Alpine, Julian, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Tierrasanta and Valley Center.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
